Research Papers on Large Language Model Security, Privacy, and Bias

Artgpt-4 is an artistic vision-language understanding model with adapter-enhanced minigpt-4.
Jinyuan Jia, Hongbin Liu, and Neil Zhenqiang Gong identified 10 security and privacy problems in large foundation models.
Michael Duan et al. investigated membership inference attacks on large language models.
Jiawen Shi et al. explored security vulnerabilities of ChatGPT through backdoor attacks.
Jiashu Xu et al. discovered backdoor vulnerabilities in instruction tuning for large language models.
Haoran Wang and Kai Shu developed a backdoor activation attack using activation steering for safety-alignment.
Zhiyuan Zhao et al. proposed enhancing large vision-language models through hallucination-aware direct preference optimization.
Yue Zhang et al. suggested alleviating hallucinations through induced hallucinations.

Research on Gender Bias and Stereotypes in Language Models

Naomi Ellemers published a study on gender stereotypes in the Annual Review of Psychology.
Jieyu Zhao et al. evaluated gender bias in coreference resolution.
Flor Miriam Plaza del Arco et al. found that large language models reflect gendered stereotypes in emotion attribution.
Yixin Wan et al. identified gender biases in LLM-generated reference letters.

Privacy and Information Leakage Studies

Robin Staab et al. investigated privacy violation through inference with large language models.
Jie Huang et al. examined whether large pre-trained language models leak personal information.
Siwon Kim et al. developed ProPILE to probe privacy leakage in large language models.

Hallucination Research in Language Models

Josh Achiam et al. published the GPT-4 technical report.
Ziwei Ji et al. conducted a survey of hallucination in natural language generation.
Lei Huang et al. published a survey on hallucination in large language models, exploring principles, taxonomy, challenges, and open questions.
Yue Zhang et al. produced a survey on hallucinations in large language models, metaphorically described as "Siren's Song in the AI Ocean".
